duties_responsibilities.duty: Supervise maintenance staff and closely monitor general maintenance of building(s) including carpentry, electrical work, HVAC, plumbing, mechanic, painting, flooring, patching, general hardware, and minor building repairs.
Maintain a safe and secure environment throughout the building(s) and supervise, train, and direct maintenance staff through work orders.
Assess repair needs, estimate the time needed for repair, and monitor the functions of service contractors and building repair and maintenance contractors.
Plan, monitor and appraise job results, coach, counsel and discipline employees, and administer preventive/reactive maintenance schedule.

Complete reports/work orders of repairs (work needed), oversee or participate in construction, installation, and preventative maintenance of equipment, and request materials, tools, and supplies needed for a job.
Maintain disaster preparedness by identifying potential problems, developing response plans, and managing crises, perform maintenance replacement and repair in various areas.
On call availability for emergencies and projects as assigned by property manager.

education_certification.credential: High school diploma or equivalency preferred. Must possess strong maintenance and repair skills in HVAC, cooling towers, chillers, painting, carpentry, plumbing and electricity. 3-5 years general experience in building trades, repair and replacement maintenance or handy work. Computer literacy: Proficiency and working knowledge of Microsoft offices applications. Word, Excel spreadsheets, and e-mail.
